detaileddescription.para:
The function dispatches the E2E tx pdus using signals' initial values. It focuses mainly on LIN Pdus since the LIN driver send the data based on the scheduling table and not based on tx request from upper layer.
reentrant No context Task level thread safe No multicore safe No synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void
void
Globals
Variable

Design Decision - Justification. :The function is designed in order to have a clear separation, of the E2E protection procedure between the ASIL and QM part. This implementation was chosen because of the multicore architecture. Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_RteLight_304

Satellite function for Core cyclic function for the SWC to SWC calls handler handle async operation has multiple use cases:
client without callback, synchronous server operation
client without callback, asynchronous server operation
client with callback, asynchronous server operation

This function is a helper function, based on SWR_ICAS1_RteLight_304, which updates the SAFE Tx LIN PDUs buffers that will be used for next transmission. This implementation was chosen because of the multicore architecture.

Design Decision - Justification. This function is a helper function, based on SWR_ICAS1_RteLight_304, which checks if the LIN PDUs were sent. In this case, it triggers the update of LIN PDUs with new Alive counter and CRC for next transmission. This implementation was chosen because of the multicore architecture.
Satisfies requirement
SWR_ICAS1_RteLight_304.

simplesect.para: Satisfies following DOORS Requirements:

detaileddescription.para:
Callback function called when the PDU is received. Timeout counter of the associated network is reset. Timeout counters associated to the PDU are reset. StartOnReceive events associated to the PDU are set. EnableUpdate counters associated to the PDU are incremented. All signals belonging to the PDU having queued handling are pushed in the queues. All multiple received signals belonging to the PDU are updated.
reentrant No context task thread safe No synchronous Security Relevance
Not Security-Relevant.
void
void Globals
Affected variables: SAMPLE_enCurrentState. SAMPLE_enRequestedState. SAMPLE_u8Intensity.

Call Sequence

Testcase shall test the counter variables of network and PDU..
Test Method

detaileddescription.para:
Dispatcher for the Start On Event runnables. There is one dispatch function for each core in order not to interrupt the already running SWC's runnable by an "callback" of the same SWC. The functionality is also refered as DRE (Data Receive Event)
